column1: Eyes, ears, nose, and throat: - Mouth irritation - Burning and redness of the eyes - Possibly serious damage to the cornea of the eyes Heart and blood: - Weakness due to low blood sugar Lungs and airways: - Shortness of breath Nervous system: - Drowsiness - Seizures (convulsions) Skin: - Bluish-colored lips and fingers - Rash (reddening or blistering of the skin) Stomach and intestines: - Cramping - Diarrhea - Stomach pain - Vomiting
Do NOT give water or milk if the patient is having symptoms (such as vomiting, convulsions, or a decreased level of alertness) that make it hard to swallow.

You may receive: - Breathing support, including tube through the mouth and breathing machine (ventilator) - Chest x-ray - EKG (heart tracing) - Surgical removal of burned skin (skin debridement) - Tube down the throat and stomach to look for burns (endoscopy) - Tube through the mouth into the stomach to wash out the stomach (gastric lavage) - Washing of the skin (irrigation) -- perhaps every few hours for several days
